title: On the effect of randomness on planted 3-coloring models.
abstract: We present the hosted coloring framework for studying al- gorithmic and hardness results for the k-coloring problem. There is a class H of host graphs. One selects a graph H ∈ H and plants in it a balanced k-coloring (by partitioning the vertex set into k roughly equal parts, and removing all edges within each part). The resulting graph G is given as input to a polynomial time algorithm that needs to k-color G (any legal k-coloring would do – the algorithm is not required to recover the planted k-coloring). Earlier planted models correspond to the case that H is the class of all n-vertex d-regular graphs, a member H ∈ H is chosen at random, and then a balanced k-coloring is planted at random.
